description:
Talk to your Mixpanel analytics events data seamlessly! Query retention number, event data, funnels and more from any MCP client. Great for on-demand look ups like: "What's the weekly retention for users in the Feb 1 cohort?"

I am adding more coverage of the Mixpanel API over time, let me know which tools you need or just open a PR.

Make sure you go to your Mixpanel Organization Settings and create a service account. Then get your project ID from your project settings.

tools.name: get_today_top_events
tools.description: Get today's top events from Mixpanel. Useful for quickly identifying the most active events happening today, spotting trends, and monitoring real-time user activity.

type.description: The type of events to fetch, either general, average, or unique, defaults to general

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

tools.name: profile_event_activity
tools.description: Get data for a profile's event activity. Useful for understanding individual user journeys, troubleshooting user-specific issues, and analyzing behavior patterns of specific users.

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

distinct_ids.description: A JSON array as a string representing the `distinct_ids` to return activity feeds for. Example: `["12a34aa567eb8d-9ab1c26f345b67-89123c45-6aeaa7-89f12af345f678"]`

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: get_top_events
tools.description: Get a list of the most common events over the last 31 days. Useful for identifying key user actions, prioritizing feature development, and understanding overall platform usage patterns.

type.description: The type of events to fetch, either general, average, or unique, defaults to general

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

tools.name: aggregate_event_counts
tools.description: Get unique, general, or average data for a set of events over N days, weeks, or months. Useful for trend analysis, comparing event performance over time, and creating time-series visualizations.

type.description: The type of data to fetch, either general, unique, or average, defaults to general

unit.description: The level of granularity of the data you get back

event.description: The event or events that you wish to get data for, a string encoded as a JSON array. Example format: "["play song", "log in", "add playlist"]"

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

interval.description: The number of units to return data for. Specify either interval or from_date and to_date

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

tools.name: aggregated_event_property_values
tools.description: Get unique, general, or average data for a single event and property over days, weeks, or months. Useful for analyzing how specific properties affect event performance, segmenting users, and identifying valuable user attributes.

name.description: The name of the property you would like to get data for

type.description: The analysis type - general, unique, or average events, defaults to general

unit.description: The level of granularity of the data (minute, hour, day, week, or month)

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for (a single event name, not an array)

limit.description: The maximum number of values to return (default: 255)

values.description: The specific property values to get data for, encoded as a JSON array. Example: "["female", "unknown"]"

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

interval.description: The number of units to return data for. Specify either interval or from_date and to_date

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

tools.name: query_insights_report
tools.description: Get data from your Insights reports. Useful for accessing saved analyses, sharing standardized metrics across teams, and retrieving complex pre-configured visualizations.

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

bookmark_id.description: The ID of your Insights report

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_funnel_report
tools.description: Get data for a funnel based on a funnel_id. Useful for analyzing user conversion paths, identifying drop-off points in user journeys, and optimizing multi-step processes. Funnel IDs should be retrieved using the list_saved_funnels tool.

length.description: The number of units each user has to complete the funnel

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

interval.description: The number of days you want each bucket to contain

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

funnel_id.description: The Mixpanel funnel ID that you wish to get data for

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

length_unit.description: The unit applied to the length parameter

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: list_saved_funnels
tools.description: Get the names and IDs of your saved funnels. Useful for discovering available funnels for analysis and retrieving funnel IDs needed for the query_funnel_report tool.

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: list_saved_cohorts
tools.description: Get all cohorts in a given project. Useful for discovering user segments, planning targeted analyses, and retrieving cohort IDs for filtering in other reports.

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_retention_report
tools.description: Get data from your Retention reports. Useful for analyzing user engagement over time, measuring product stickiness, and understanding how well your product retains users after specific actions. Only use params interval or unit, not both.

on.description: The property expression to segment the second event on

unit.description: The interval unit: 'day' (eg use if asked for D7 or D30), 'week' (eg use if asked for W12), or 'month' (eg use if asked for M6). Default is 'day'. DO NOT USE IF ALREADY PROVIDING INTERVAL.

event.description: The event to generate returning counts for. If not specified, looks across all events

limit.description: Return the top limit segmentation values. Only applies when 'on' is specified

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

interval.description: The number of units per individual bucketed interval. Default is 1. DO NOT USE IF ALREADY PROVIDING UNIT.

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

born_event.description: The first event a user must do to be counted in a birth retention cohort, required if retention_type is 'birth'. Can use $mp_web_page_view as the born_event for general cases.

born_where.description:
An expression to filter born_events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

return_where.description:
An expression to filter return events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

interval_count.description: The number of individual buckets/intervals to return. Default is 1. DO NOT USE IF ALREADY PROVIDING UNIT.

retention_type.description: Type of retention: 'birth' (first time) or 'compounded' (recurring). Defaults to 'birth'

tools.name: custom_jql
tools.description: Run a custom JQL (JSON Query Language) script against your Mixpanel data. Useful for complex custom analyses, advanced data transformations, and queries that can't be handled by standard report types.

params.description: A JSON string containing parameters to pass to the script (will be available as the 'params' variable)

script.description: The JQL script to run (JavaScript code that uses Mixpanel's JQL functions)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_segmentation_sum
tools.description: Sum a numeric expression for events over time. Useful for calculating revenue metrics, aggregating quantitative values, and tracking cumulative totals across different time periods.

on.description: The expression to sum per unit time (should result in a numeric value)

unit.description: Time bucket size: 'hour' or 'day'. Default is 'day'

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for (single event name, not an array)

where.description:
An expression to filter events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_profiles
tools.description: Query Mixpanel user profiles with filtering options. Useful for retrieving detailed user profiles, filtering by specific properties, and analyzing user behavior across different dimensions.

page.description: Which page of the results to retrieve. Pages start at zero. If the 'page' parameter is provided, the session_id parameter must also be provided

where.description:
An expression to filter users (or groups) by. Using the following grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <typecast op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | '(' <expression> ')'
                | <boolean literal>
                | <numeric literal>
                | <string literal>
  <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
   <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'
    <math op> ::= 'floor' | 'round' | 'ceil'
<typecast op> ::= 'boolean' | 'number' | 'string'
   <property> ::= 'properties["' <property name> '"]'

behaviors.description: If you are exporting user profiles using an event selector, you use a 'behaviors' parameter in your request

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.. Optional since it has a default.

session_id.description: A string id provided in the results of a previous query. Using a session_id speeds up api response, and allows paging through results

distinct_id.description: A unique identifier used to distinguish an individual profile

distinct_ids.description: A JSON array of distinct_ids to retrieve profiles for. Example: '["id1", "id2"]'

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

data_group_id.description: The ID of the group key, used when querying group profiles

as_of_timestamp.description: This parameter is only useful when also using 'behaviors'

filter_by_cohort.description: Takes a JSON object with a single key called 'id' whose value is the cohort ID. Example: '{"id":12345}'

include_all_users.description: Only applicable with 'filter_by_cohort' parameter. Default is true

output_properties.description: A JSON array of names of properties you want returned. Example: '["$last_name", "$email", "Total Spent"]'

tools.name: query_frequency_report
tools.description: Get data for frequency of actions over time. Useful for analyzing how often users perform specific actions, identifying patterns of behavior, and tracking user engagement over time.

on.description: The property expression to segment the second event on

unit.description: The overall time period to return frequency of actions for

event.description: The event to generate returning counts for

limit.description: Return the top limit segmentation values. This parameter does nothing if 'on' is not specified

where.description:
An expression to filter the returning events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

addiction_unit.description: The granularity to return frequency of actions at

tools.name: query_segmentation_report
tools.description: Get data for an event, segmented and filtered by properties. Useful for breaking down event data by user attributes, comparing performance across segments, and identifying which user groups perform specific actions.

on.description: The property expression to segment the event on

type.description: The type of analysis to perform, either general, unique, or average, defaults to general

unit.description: The buckets into which the property values that you segment on are placed. Default is 'day'

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for. Note: this is a single event name, not an array

limit.description: Return the top property values. Defaults to 60. Maximum value 10,000. This parameter does nothing if 'on' is not specified

where.description:
An expression to filter events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

interval.description: Optional parameter in lieu of 'unit' when 'type' is not 'general'. Determines the number of days your results are bucketed into

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_segmentation_bucket
tools.description: Get data for an event, segmented and filtered by properties, with values placed into numeric buckets. Useful for analyzing distributions of numeric values, creating histograms, and understanding the range of quantitative metrics.

on.description: The property expression to segment the event on. This expression must be a numeric property

type.description: The type of analysis to perform, either general, unique, or average, defaults to general

unit.description: The buckets into which the property values that you segment on are placed. Default is 'day'

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for. Note: this is a single event name, not an array

where.description:
An expression to filter events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: query_segmentation_average
tools.description: Averages an expression for events per unit time. Useful for calculating average values like purchase amounts, session durations, or any numeric metric, and tracking how these averages change over time.

on.description: The expression to average per unit time. The result of the expression should be a numeric value

unit.description: The buckets [hour, day] into which the property values are placed. Default is 'day'

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for. Note: this is a single event name, not an array

where.description:
An expression to filter events by based on the grammar: <expression> ::= 'properties["' <property> '"]'
                | <expression> <binary op> <expression>
                | <unary op> <expression>
                | <math op> '(' <expression> ')'
                | <string literal>
   <binary op> ::= '+' | '-' | '*' | '/' | '%' | '==' | '!=' |
                  '>' | '>=' | '<' | '<=' | 'in' | 'and' | 'or'
                | <unary op> ::= '-' | 'not'

to_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to query to (inclusive)

from_date.description: The date in yyyy-mm-dd format to begin querying from (inclusive)

project_id.description: The Mixpanel project ID. Optional since it has a default.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: top_event_properties
tools.description: Get the top property names for an event. Useful for discovering which properties are most commonly associated with an event, prioritizing which dimensions to analyze, and understanding event structure.

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for. Note: this is a single event name, not an array

limit.description: The maximum number of properties to return. Defaults to 10

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable

tools.name: top_event_property_values
tools.description: Get the top values for a property. Useful for understanding the distribution of values for a specific property, identifying the most common categories or segments, and planning further targeted analyses.

name.description: The name of the property you would like to get data for

event.description: The event that you wish to get data for. Note: this is a single event name, not an array

limit.description: The maximum number of values to return. Defaults to 255

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace if applicable
